lead_paragraph: The company wants the bank to seek new investment and shape a deal with automakers on sharing the cost of replacing defective equipment.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and HIROKO TABUCHI

headline.print_headline: Takata, Short of Cash, Wants Carmakers to Share Costs of Its Recall
headline.main: Takata Hires Lazard as Airbag Maker Bids to Remain ‘Viable’

snippet: The company wants the bank to seek new investment and shape a deal with automakers on sharing the cost of replacing defective equipment.
abstract: Takata, in midst of defective airbag recall, hires Lazard to help it find new cash investments; says it will share costs of replacing airbags with affected carmakers.
